articles.name: Where can I find training resources for Zendesk Advanced AI?
articles.title: Where can I find training resources for Zendesk Advanced AI?
articles.body:
Question

I want to learn more about using Zendesk Advanced AI (now called Agent Copilot). Where can I access official training courses and documentation to help me get started and stay up to date with new AI features?

Answer

Zendesk provides several official training and documentation resources to help you build skills with Advanced AI and learn best practices.

Start with the Zendesk Advanced AI Learning Path, which offers a structured introduction for customers using Advanced AI or moving from AI Agents (Legacy).

You can also review related help center articles for setup guidance and detailed explanations of how AI features work, such as:

  • Getting started with AI features in the Zendesk Copilot add-on
  • Optimizing your help center content for AI agents
  • Reviewing AI agent conversation transcripts
  • Reviewing and assigning intents for common questions without AI agent answers (Legacy)
  • Using AI to generate replies in an AI agent for messaging (Legacy)

For more information, see this article: AI agent resources

articles.name: Does my AI agent track activity on my website?
articles.title: Does my AI agent track activity on my website?
articles.body:
Question

Can my AI agent monitor customer activity on my website to automatically provide prompts, recommendations, or articles in real time?

Answer

No. The AI agent doesn't track individual customer activity on your website in real time or use that activity to suggest prompts or articles. It doesn't monitor browsing history, clicks, or navigation patterns outside an active Zendesk messaging session.

Instead, you can use proactive messaging. This feature lets you configure custom messages that appear to customers when specific conditions are met. This setup looks like real‑time engagement, but it relies on the rules you define. The AI agent doesn't track user actions or make predictions.

If you want to engage customers dynamically based on their behavior or navigation path, use proactive messages in Zendesk.

  • Define conditions such as pages visited, time spent, or other triggers
  • Automatically display a message, greeting, or article through the Web Widget or mobile SDK
  • Choose whether an AI agent or a live agent continues the chat after the customer responds

This approach lets you simulate a real‑time, contextual experience without your AI agent directly tracking customers’ actions across your website.

Proactive messages are available only on the Web Widget and mobile SDK messaging channels. They appear based on the conditions you set, not on continuous tracking.

For more information, see the following articles:

  • Creating proactive messages for the Web Widget
  • Creating proactive messages for mobile SDK channels

articles.name: How can I customize my Generative AI bot greeting?
articles.title: How can I customize my Generative AI bot greeting?
articles.body:
Question

How can I change the greeting that appears when my Generative AI bot starts a chat?

Answer

When you use Generative AI with your AI agent, the greeting at the start of each chat is generated in real time. This greeting is part of the AI’s composed message and cannot be rewritten directly.

You can influence the behavior of Generative AI replies through settings such as persona, tone of voice, and reply length. These options shape the communication style but do not let you edit the precise words or structure of the greeting.

Currently, you can’t manually edit the greeting text that Generative AI creates. To influence its behavior and make the opening message closer to your brand voice:

  • Go to AI agents > select the AI agent you want to update > Settings > Persona
  • Adjust settings like Tone of voice or Messaging reply length. These settings affect the style but don’t allow changing the exact wording or structure.

If you need full control of your greeting and other standard replies, use a standard AI agent (Messaging) instead of Generative AI. Go to Messaging behavior > Start of the conversation, and enter the text you want customers to see. You can also include response options, such as a Talk to a human button.

For more information, see this article: Customizing the standard responses for an AI agent on a messaging channel

articles.name: Service Incident - October 07, 2025 - Multiple pods | Support - Unable to update ticket | Error: an app has timed out and has prevented the submission of the ticket.
articles.title: Service Incident - October 07, 2025 - Multiple pods | Support - Unable to update ticket | Error: an app has timed out and has prevented the submission of the ticket.
articles.body:
SUMMARY

Timeline

October 07, 2025 10:59 UTC | October 07, 2025 03:59 AM PT

Our engineers have identified the cause of the issue and recommend the following temporary workaround while they work on a permanent fix:

  • Disable the AppReviews by AppFollow
  • Relaunch the ticket console

Please let us know if this resolves the issue on your end. Should the problem persist, do not hesitate to contact us for further assistance.

 

October 07, 2025 10:18 UTC | October 07, 2025 03:18 AM PT

We have received reports of customers experiencing difficulties updating and submitting tickets in Zendesk Support. Our engineers are actively investigating the issue. We apologize for the inconvenience caused and will provide updates as they become available.

 

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about Zendesk and specific impacts to your account, visit our system status page. You can follow this article to be notified when our post-mortem report is published. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.
